title: Ecological/Bioregional Layer Value Recognition for Middle-Aged Adult
description: As a middle-aged adult in the value scanner system Operating at the ecological/bioregional governance layer I want to integrate care for people with care for planet through sustainable practices So that I model ecological stewardship for the next generation and build resilient bioregional care economy

Feature: Ecological/Bioregional Layer Value Recognition for Middle-Aged Adult
  As a middle-aged adult in the value scanner system
  Operating at the ecological/bioregional governance layer
  I want to integrate care for people with care for planet through sustainable practices
  So that I model ecological stewardship for the next generation and build resilient bioregional care economy

  Background:
    Given the Elohim Protocol is operational
    And the middle-aged user "Robert" is registered in the system
    And Robert is 52 years old managing household and multigenerational care
    And the ecological governance context is active
    And bioregional_elohim coordinates ecological care economy
    And Robert's consumption and care practices affect ecological systems

  Scenario: Household consumption patterns analyzed for ecological impact
    Given Robert's household consumes resources and generates waste
    And consumption choices affect ecological systems
    And middle-aged adults often have highest consumption footprint
    When bioregional_elohim analyzes household ecological impact
    Then it should track resource consumption, energy use, and waste generation
    And surface patterns: "Your household consumes 40% above bioregional sustainable average"
    And help Robert understand ecological impact of consumption choices
    And connect consumption to bioregional carrying capacity
    And support reduction strategies that maintain quality of life
    And demonstrate that care economy includes ecological care
    And build household practices that serve bioregional health

  Scenario: Care economy practices integrated with ecological sustainability
    Given care work requires resources: food, transportation, housing, energy
    And care practices can be more or less ecologically sustainable
    And sustainable care economy serves both human and ecological flourishing
    When bioregional_elohim integrates care and ecology
    Then it should help Robert align care practices with ecological sustainability
    And surface opportunities: "Local food sourcing reduces transportation impact while supporting regional care economy"
    And recognize that care for people and care for planet are interconnected
    And support practices that serve both human and ecological wellbeing
    And demonstrate that care economy must be ecologically sustainable
    And build integrated understanding of care and ecology
    And model for next generation that care includes ecological stewardship

  Scenario: Multigenerational teaching about ecological care responsibility
    Given Robert teaches values to children and grandchildren through practice
    And ecological sustainability requires intergenerational commitment
    And his generation must prepare next generation for ecological challenges
    When bioregional_elohim supports ecological education
    Then it should help Robert model ecological care practices for younger generations
    And surface teaching opportunities through everyday choices
    And recognize: "Your composting practice teaches grandchildren about waste reduction"
    And support him in explaining ecological choices to family
    And build intergenerational ecological literacy through practice
    And demonstrate that ecological care is care economy responsibility
    And prepare next generation for ecological stewardship

  Scenario: Bioregional food systems participation supports care and ecology
    Given Robert's household needs food
    And food choices affect ecological health and care economy
    And bioregional food systems can serve both
    When bioregional_elohim supports food system participation
    Then it should connect Robert to bioregional food networks
    And surface opportunities for local food sourcing, community gardens, and food cooperatives
    And recognize that supporting regional farmers is care economy participation
    And help him understand food system ecological impact
    And support food choices that serve bioregional health and care economy
    And demonstrate that eating is care for people and planet
    And build bioregional food resilience through participation

  Scenario: Transportation choices balance care needs with ecological impact
    Given Robert travels for work, parent care, and family support
    And transportation has substantial ecological impact
    And care responsibilities create transportation needs
    When bioregional_elohim analyzes transportation
    Then it should track transportation ecological impact
    And help Robert optimize travel to reduce impact while meeting care needs
    And surface alternatives: "Video call could replace 200-mile drive for parent check-in"
    And recognize when care needs require travel despite ecological cost
    And support sustainable transportation choices where possible
    And prevent guilt about necessary care-related travel
    And build transportation patterns that balance care and ecology

  Scenario: Housing and energy use optimized for sustainability
    Given Robert's household uses energy for heating, cooling, and power
    And housing energy use significantly affects ecological impact
    And household improvements can reduce ecological footprint
    When bioregional_elohim supports energy optimization
    Then it should analyze household energy consumption patterns
    And suggest improvements: insulation, renewable energy, efficiency upgrades
    And connect energy reduction to cost savings that support care economy participation
    And help Robert prioritize improvements within household budget
    And recognize that sustainable housing serves current and future generations
    And demonstrate that ecological stewardship is long-term care
    And build household infrastructure that reduces bioregional impact

  Scenario: Bioregional care economy networks reduce consumption through sharing
    Given many resources are underutilized in individual households
    And sharing reduces consumption while building care networks
    And bioregional resilience requires resource cooperation
    When bioregional_elohim facilitates resource sharing
    Then it should connect Robert to bioregional sharing networks
    And support participation in tool libraries, car sharing, and resource exchange
    And recognize that sharing reduces ecological impact and builds care economy
    And track ecological benefits of sharing: "Tool sharing prevented 8 redundant purchases"
    And demonstrate that care economy and ecological sustainability are aligned
    And build bioregional resilience through sharing economy
    And reduce consumption through care economy participation

  Scenario: Lifecycle consumption awareness from birth through end-of-life
    Given Robert has observed full lifecycle from grandchildren to aging parents
    And he recognizes consumption patterns across lifespan
    And lifecycle awareness can inform sustainable choices
    When bioregional_elohim supports lifecycle consumption awareness
    Then it should help Robert understand consumption across full lifecycle
    And surface how current choices affect future generations' ecological inheritance
    And recognize: "Reducing consumption now preserves resources for grandchildren's future"
    And connect present choices to long-term bioregional health
    And support sustainable consumption motivated by intergenerational care
    And demonstrate that ecological stewardship is care for future generations
    And build consumption patterns that serve lifecycle sustainability

  Scenario: Bioregional governance participation includes ecological voice
    Given bioregional health requires governance that includes ecological considerations
    And Robert participates in community and municipal governance
    And his voice can advocate for bioregional ecological health
    When bioregional_elohim supports ecological governance
    Then it should help Robert bring ecological perspective to governance participation
    And support advocacy for bioregional ecological protection
    And connect him to watershed councils, land use planning, and environmental policy
    And recognize his care economy participation as qualifying him for ecological governance
    And build governance that integrates human and ecological flourishing
    And advance bioregional policy that serves care economy and ecology
    And demonstrate that care economy includes bioregional stewardship

  Scenario: Climate adaptation planning for multigenerational family resilience
    Given climate change affects bioregional systems
    And Robert's family will navigate climate impacts across generations
    And adaptation planning protects family and bioregional resilience
    When bioregional_elohim supports climate adaptation
    Then it should help Robert plan for climate impacts on family
    And surface bioregional climate risks: drought, flooding, extreme weather
    And support household adaptation: water conservation, emergency preparedness, resilient food systems
    And connect adaptation to care economy principles
    And recognize that climate adaptation is care for family and bioregion
    And build resilience that serves current and future generations
    And demonstrate that ecological care is practical family responsibility

  Scenario: Work and career choices evaluated for ecological impact
    Given Robert's professional work affects ecological systems
    And career choices have bioregional ecological consequences
    And some work serves ecological health while other work degrades it
    When bioregional_elohim analyzes professional ecological impact
    Then it should help Robert understand his work's ecological footprint
    And surface opportunities to align profession with ecological health
    And recognize when professional choices serve or harm bioregional systems
    And support career decisions that integrate care economy and ecological values
    And demonstrate that professional work is ecological care or harm
    And build careers that serve bioregional flourishing
    And advance ecological sustainability through professional choices

  Scenario: Bioregional economic localization supports care and ecological resilience
    Given globalized economy increases ecological impact
    And bioregional economic localization can reduce impact while building care economy
    And Robert's economic choices affect regional resilience
    When bioregional_elohim supports economic localization
    Then it should help Robert source goods and services bioregionally
    And connect him to regional producers, workers, and care economy networks
    And recognize that local economic participation reduces transportation impact
    And demonstrate that care economy and ecological sustainability align through localization
    And build bioregional economic resilience through local exchange
    And reduce ecological impact through regional economic relationships
    And advance care economy through bioregional economic networks

  Scenario: Legacy and intergenerational responsibility for bioregional health
    Given Robert's generation has substantially affected bioregional ecology
    And his choices affect ecological inheritance for grandchildren
    And intergenerational responsibility requires ecological repair and protection
    When bioregional_elohim supports legacy planning
    Then it should help Robert understand his generation's ecological impact
    And recognize responsibility to repair damage and protect bioregional health
    And surface opportunities for ecological restoration participation
    And support him in building positive ecological legacy
    And connect ecological stewardship to care for grandchildren's future
    And demonstrate that care economy includes intergenerational ecological responsibility
    And build commitment to bioregional health as care for future generations
